p: Adult vs. protoscolex: a total of 391 differentially expressed proteins were observed between adults and the protoscolex, with 127 up-regulated and 264 down-regulated. Metabolic pathways showed that they are involved in metabolic, several diseases, and focal adhesion pathways ( Table 5). Partial significant differential expression proteins are listed in Table 2. Following GO analysis, partial representative GO terms of differentially expressed proteins were assigned as “oxidoreductase activity (including acting on the CH-OH group of donors, NAD or NADP as acceptor”, and “ion binding” ( Table 8).
